content.title: Huawei finance chief Meng Wanzhou to appear in court as Chinese media react furiously to arrest - The Independent
content.desc: Huawei’s finance chief is set to appear at a bail hearing in Vancouver on Friday amid a backlash in Chinese media over her detention. Chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou, daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was arrested by Canadian authorities on Saturday at the request of the US government which is seeking extradition. No official reason has been given but it is thought to be linked to alleged violations of US sanctions on Iran. Stock markets calmed on Friday following a tumultuous session on Thursday as news of Ms Meng’s detention prompted fears of a new front on the US-China trade ...

content.title: US case against Huawei CFO revealed in Canadian court - CNN
content.desc: The United States is claiming that the chief financial officer of Chinese tech giant Huawei covered up violations of sanctions on Iran, according to Canadian prosecutors. Meng Wanzhou, who was arrested in Vancouver and faces extradition to the United States, is believed to have helped Huawei circumvent US sanctions by telling financial institutions that a Huawei subsidiary was a separate company, prosecutors said at a hearing Friday to determine whether Meng should be released on bail. content.title: 🇨🇳Huawei CFO’s arrest rattles investors, markets tumble l Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
content.desc: American stocks clawed back much of the ground lost in an early plunge triggered by the news of the arrest of Huawei Technologies CFO, Meng Wanzhou, in Canada at the United States’ request. The initial drop joined a global rout, reviving worries over trade tensions. Meng’s arrest threatens to drive a wedge between the US and China just days after they agreed on a 90-day trade-war truce in Argentina on Saturday. content.title: China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest - Reuters
content.desc: China's Huawei Technologies has appointed Chairman Liang Hua as acting chief financial officer (CFO) following the arrest in Canada of its CFO, who faces extradition to the United States, staff briefed on an internal memo told Reuters. Huawei did not immediately respond to a request for comment. CFO Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was detained in Canada on Saturday at the request of U.S. authorities. (Reporting By Sijia Jiang in HONG KONG and Yilei Sun in BEIJING; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree and Kim Coghill)

content.title: Huawei CFO committed fraud in breach of US sanctions, prosecutors say - The Guardian
content.desc: A senior Chinese telecoms executive committed fraud when she lied about links between Huawei and a shell company used to sell telecommunications equipment to Iran in breach of US sanctions, Canadian prosecutors have told a Vancouver court. content.title: Huawei appoints chairman as interim CFO following arrest of Meng Wanzhou - The Telegraph
content.desc: Chinese telecoms giant Huawei has appointed chairman Liang Hua as interim chief financial officer following the arrest of his predecessor in Canada. Mr Liang has been a part of the company since 1995 and takes up the position following the arrest of Meng Wanzhou at Vancouver airport in an escalating trade dispute.
